name: NPR
text: George Clooney on the legacy he hopes to impart to his two kids: "If you only in your lifetime challenge people with power and defend people with less power, if you only do that in your life, you will be a success." https://t.co/roY2CYQCuA

name: NPR
text: California hospitals are stretched to their limits as COVID-19 cases climb and ICUs fill up. https://t.co/C3L7tps1wE

name: NPR
text: Congress is close to a deal on a handful of higher education measures that would provide meaningful help to marginalized students, students of color and many of the schools that serve them. https://t.co/46pjnEUCQ2

name: NPR
text: The measures include restoring Pell Grant eligibility for would-be students who are incarcerated.

name: NPR
text: Inmates are among the least educated people in America, but few prisons offer opportunities beyond a GED. An @npr_ed comic from 2018 dives into a timely question: What if people behind bars had access to federal money to help pay for college? https://t.co/KkdYv0XF48

name: NPR
text: More than 1 million people went through checkpoints at U.S. airports on each of the past two days. That's down considerably from a year ago, but still an increase over typical pandemic travel levels. https://t.co/Fwv2nKhKuk

name: NPR
text: Dozens of children were rescued after being abducted on Saturday in the second mass kidnapping of schoolchildren in Nigeria's Katsina state in eight days. https://t.co/N37ahGUN7y

name: NPR
text: The arrival of the first shipments of a COVID-19 vaccine was celebrated this past week by those who've been caring for patients since the early days of the pandemic. Some tens of thousands of healthcare workers were immunized. https://t.co/yUZaL9YUNQ

name: NPR
text: Rocket attacks by "Iran-backed militias" into an area housing the U.S. embassy in Iraq killed at least one local civilian and damaged the embassy compound, according to U.S. diplomatic sources. https://t.co/qOaLQKGVEM

name: NPR
text: RT @nprmusic: What role can hip-hop play in reforming â€“ or entirely dismantling â€“ mass incarceration? Rapper Noname and activist Mariame Kaba joined @LouderThanARiot to discuss making revolution irresistible. https://t.co/ysg5iBdFWx

name: NPR
text: NPR Music's classical editor traces the high points of a year spent listening to new albums that offered comfort and confrontation in counterpoint with the relentless world outside the headphones. https://t.co/jOnW8Y22xX

name: NPR
text: President-elect Joe Biden and incoming first lady Jill Biden will both publicly receive their first doses of a COVID-19 vaccine in Delaware on Monday, as the death toll from the disease nears 320,000 in the United States. https://t.co/F3GP1jr4g5

name: NPR
text: The U.S. Justice Department is set to charge a Libyan man with constructing a bomb that detonated on a passenger plane over Lockerbie, Scotland, in 1988, killing 270 people and launching a decades-long international manhunt for the culprits. https://t.co/HPh3NnxbeU

name: NPR
text: The lead attorney for the city of Chicago resigned Sunday amid continuing fallout from a botched and mistaken police raid nearly a year ago at the home of a Black woman. https://t.co/pzPU4885h5

name: NPR
text: As Georgia prepares for runoff elections on Jan. 5, President Trump's pressure on Georgia's Republican leaders to overturn the results of the presidential election is sending mixed messages to GOP voters. https://t.co/0DxOAqxs0B

name: NPR
text: The holidays will be different this year. Why not follow that theme with your dinner menu? Save the more conventional fare for when family and friend can safely gather again. https://t.co/PhvqndOJ7d

name: NPR
text:
At a time when the pandemic has exposed a growing shortage of nurses, it should have been good news that there were more than 1,200 applicants for the nursing program at Long Beach City College.

But the California community college took only 32 of them. https://t.co/JrrO7DpGu8

name: NPR
text: Mourning and celebrating; coping and distancing: 2020 has been a year of collective emotional dissonance. Here are the stories that hit home in 2020. https://t.co/Kgs46UbqM6

name: NPR
text: RT @relucasz: AG Barr says he thinks the federal investigation into Hunter Biden is being handled responsibly. He says he sees no reason to appoint a special counsel for it and says he has no plans to appoint one.AG Barr says he thinks the federal investigation into Hunter Biden is being handled responsibly. He says he sees noâ€¦ https://t.co/jzZcxGEoBJ

name: NPR
text: If you'd prefer to experience the charms of winter from a safe (and warm) distance, Boston's Museum of Fine Art has some beautiful snowy scenes for you to admire. https://t.co/T9fHRNIl35

name: NPR
text:
Here's a look at some of the details announced by congressional leaders from both parties:

â€¢ $600 direct payment checks for every adult and child earning up to $75,000.
â€¢ Extended enhanced unemployment benefits
â€¢ $25 billion to help Families pay rent

https://t.co/t1XyO6PbhO

name: NPR
text: Dec. 21 is the shortest day of the year in the Northern Hemisphere. Author Susan Cooper and illustrator Carson Ellis created a story called The Shortest Day that celebrates light triumphing over darkness, and as the day ends we prepare for a new year. https://t.co/hRIiLsgudR

name: NPR
text: The European Union's drug agency has recommended authorizing use of the coronavirus vaccine developed by Pfizer and BioNTech. If the EU's executive arm, the European Commission, greenlights the drug, inoculations can start across Europe. https://t.co/wrKTQWTYwv
